definition: no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
surname Ji
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
surname Shi
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out

sentences.english: The doctor there, announced MiaoQing the facts of death.
sentences.chinese: 医生无计可施，宣布苗青死亡的事实。

sentences.english: Not even the best doctor in the country could cure her.
sentences.chinese: 大家都无计可施，全国最好的良医也没办法救她的病。

sentences.english: To say that we can't do anything about America's drug problem is a cop-out .
sentences.chinese: 说我们对美国的毒品问题无计可施是在逃避责任。

sentences.english: Fortunately, there is a workaround to this problem.
sentences.chinese: 幸运的是，对这个问题并非无计可施。

definition: lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
have no way out/have no alternative/abbr. to 無奈|无奈[wu2 nai4]
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
to no avail/of no use
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway
impotent (idiom)/powerless/helpless
to worry helplessly
to exhaust one's limited abilities (idiom)
to have no way out/to have no alternative
out of one's wits (idiom)/distracted/stunned
to be at an impasse (idiom)/in a tight spot/at the end of one's rope/desperate
lit. there is no road to the sky, nor door into the earth (idiom)/fig. to be at the end of one's rope/to be trapped in a hopeless situation
pinyin: shang4 tian1 wu2 lu4 , ru4 di4 wu2 men2

definition: lit. to refrain from shooting at the rat for fear of breaking the vases (idiom)/to not act against an evil so as to prevent harm to innocents
there is no alternative
unhelpful/useless
